phrases: Only three of you are running under thirty minutes.
I am impressed you are all able to run a 10K now, but...
We still have three weeks until the qualifier.
20km is the base distance for cross country, but none of us will drop out.
On the track, I am planning to push the build-up runs we would been holding back on this spring,
so we can finish the last thousand meters in 2:50.
You got a bunch of total amateurs to the qualifier.
That is more than good enough to hold your own coaching lecture.
Making it to the qualifier is not our goal.
My legs and hips are shot, but I still have my experience.
I will tell you everything I can.
Looks like your legs and hips still work.
Kansei University honors the spirit of Matsudaira Sadanobu,
We value both academics and athletics.
I never thought I would appear in a newspaper.
Aiming For the Top” 10 men take on the Hakone Ekiden
Since you have not made it through the qualifier,
getting you into the sports section might be difficult,
but your attempt itself is captivating.
I will have your story run in the local news section.
We are all hoping you will make it through the qualifier.
I wish I could run right now.
They saw us in the paper.
They yelled at us for throwing peace signs.
My parents told me to smile more.
Normal, with faces that look like mine.
What do you think my parents are?
Everyone is so devoted to their parents.
Actually, we even received an interview request from Nippon TV.
I did not know, but the qualifier is televised, too.
They even broadcast interviews with a handful of particularly notable schools.
And we were chosen for that?
I have not responded yet, though.
If the cameras prevented us from focusing on the race,
we would be putting the cart before the horse.
I want to be on TV!
Well, it will certainly be good for promoting the team.
I do not care either way.
I wonder if they will send a lady reporter.
We will finally be popular with girls.
Will not appearing on TV because trouble for you?
We are going to be on TV.
My maybe” became a definitely” today.
Did not I tell you I made a discovery when we were in the bath together?
They are definitely those of a woman in love.
There is no other reason she would make that face.
Hana definitely loves one of the twins.
Youth is beautiful, is not it?
They are practically the same person.
Yes, so it is one or the other.
The Hakone qualifier starts at the Self-Defense Force base,
We will start by running two laps around the airstrip and taxiway.
Then we will head out onto the road, pass the station,
and cross under the monorail bridge.
The turnaround point is at 11.2 km.
When we return to the park, we will have run fifteen kilometers.
We will run a lap through the hilly park.
The finish line is next to the Minna-no Harappa Field.
I expected the finish line to be flashier.
You will see the day of the race.
It will not matter if it is plain or flashy anymore.
And they will announce the results here?
This is where our destiny will be decided.
Do you think I am being soft?
Should I have made them run more?
Before I sleep, while I am eating, when I am in the bathroom.
My doubts are constantly following me.
Should I have imposed more rules like a stronger school
and forced them to run more?
You cannot force a person to run.
The only thing that makes a person run is their own will.
I was constantly suffering when I ran during high school.
I do not ever want to be restricted like that again.
This time, I will run of my own free will.
Freely, far away, to the end of the world.
People always want to be strong.
We have two weeks until the qualifier.
It is a battle of concentration now.
We will need to focus and exercise self-control,
so we can go into the qualifier in top physical and mental shape.
There is nothing to be afraid of.
We have trained more than enough.
We just need to turn that pressure into a rasp and polish our minds and bodies.
Imagine yourself running as a beautiful blade on the day of the qualifier
and diligently polish yourselves to a fine point.
We should be like tempered katanas.
We will be screwed if we polish too much and break before the race, though.
Listen to your minds and bodies and polish carefully.
Competitions are strange things, and I do not just mean long-distance races.
All that is left is to run.
Or so you would think, but for some reason, some runners self-destruct.
Most things we call mistakes are the result of pressure or weakness of the mind.
No matter how much you practice,
you cannot stop the anxiety from rising to the surface.
No matter how certain you are, you still cannot erase your fear of failure.
The more you polish something, the more fragile it becomes,
just as a little bit of dust can ruin a delicate machine.
True strength, so we will not be defeated by ourselves!
Should you be doing this two days before the qualifier?
This is how we do things.
Tomorrow, we will sit and wait for the next day!
It is time for a message from our coach.
I will share my secret to success.
Alternate using your left and right feet.
Do that, and you will eventually arrive at the finish line.
When are you going to start acting like a coach?
You cannot say it did not feel like it would be no exaggeration
to say he spoke the truth.
What the hell are you trying to say?
Kakeru, could you bring up some ice from downstairs?
This has nothing to do with you.
I have not seen them in a while.
You cannot have different track suits forever.
They are a present from everyone at the shopping center.
Today, we are taking our first step towards winning the Hakone Ekiden!
Hey, is he a regular now?
You cannot help but look at the cheerleaders, huh?
Haiji said they would make it if their combined time was less than 1000.
That is just over an hour per person.
A full marathon takes over two hours.
They will have to run like professionals.
That is just over three minutes per kilometer.
As you can see, there are no landmarks.
It will be tough to judge your distance.
The weather's poor, and we do not know how the race will go,
but do not get dragged along by runners recklessly charging ahead.
Kakeru and I will run in front.
Stay together and maintain your own pace in the beginning.
By the time we finish one lap around the airstrip,
a lot of guys should start to fall behind.
I will be sending signals during the race.
Do not lose sight of each other.
I am glad it is the ten of us.
We would not be here if anyone had been missing.
Do not make it sound like the final episode of something.
There are different numbers of guys wearing uniforms.
I was wondering about that, too.
They have got more than ten guys.
A team can register up to fourteen runners for the qualifier.
Then they will reduce their numbers to twelve based on their physical condition.
So they calculate your total time based on your ten fastest runners?
Teams with lots of runners have two runners as insurance.
So this is what they call a numbers game.
It also means Kansei is finished if a single one of their runners
does not make it to the finish line.
I will do the best I can.
Runners, please gather at the starting line.
Runners, please gather at the starting line.
Is not our starting position kind of a big handicap?
Even if they were not seeded, the people who ran at Hakone last year feel different.
Finish the first five kilometers in 3:10 each.
After that, use your own judgment.
Just two laps of this makes me feel faint.
The runners are starting their second lap!
Do not let them drag you ahead!
